advisory_message:
Stop Discontinuation | Wynnewood Rd. & Lanca ster Ave. (Westbound)

Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the Route 105 westbound transit stop at Wynnewood Rd. and Lancaster Ave. will be discontinued until further notice

Customers should use the stop on Wynnewood Rd. at Penn Rd. (Wynnewood Station)

Temporary Stop Discontinuation

Until Further Notice

Due to area construction, the Eastbound Transit stop for Routes 92, 105, and 106 on Lancaster Ave. and Valley Rd. will be discontinued until further notice

Customers should use the next eastbound stop, located at Lancaster Ave. and Darby Rd.

Temporary Stop Discontinuation

Until Further Notice

Due to area construction, the Eastbound Transit stop for Routes 92, 105, and 106 on Lancaster Ave. and Valley Rd. will be discontinued until further notice

Customers should use the next eastbound stop, located at Lancaster Ave. and Darby Rd.

Transit Stop Discontinued | 19th & Chestnut (1900 Block of Chestnut St.)

Until Further Notce

Due to construction, the Transit stop located at 19th & Chestnut Sts. will be temporarily discontinued

Customers should use Google transit for alternate stops and service information

Stop Temporarily Discontinued

Effective Wednesday, October 1, 2014 Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the Bus Stop located on Market St. between 11th and 12th Sts. has been temporarily discontinued

As an alternate, customers should use the stop at 9th and Market Sts.

Customers may use the Trip Planner tool for alternate travel information

Stop Temporarily Discontinued

Until Further Notice

Due to area construction, the southbound stop at Roosevelt Blvd. and Holmes Ave. will be discontinued during the dates noted above

Customers can use Plan My Trip or Google Transit for alternate service information

Temporary Stop Discontinuation | 16th & Walnut Sts.

Discontinued Until Monday, May 30, 2016

Due to construction, the Bus stop at 16th & Walnut Sts. is discontinued for Routes 9, 12, 21, and 42

Customers should use the next stop at 17th & Walnut Sts. for service

Please continue to check System Status for updates or additional information

Stop Discontinued | 19th & Chestnut Sts. (1900 Block of Chestnut St.)

Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the Transit stop located at 19th & Chestnut Sts. will be temporarily discontinued

Customers should use Google transit for alternate stops and service information

Chestnut Bridge Weight Restrictions

Until Further Notice

Due to weight restrictions on the Chestnut Street Bridge, the following stops are discontinued:

30th & Chestnut

Schuylkill Ave (29th St)

24th Street on Chestnut Street

Detour & Boarding Location Change | Unstable Building

Until Further Notice

Due to an unstable building adjacent to the Chester Transportation Center entrance passengers will board on Welsh St. (opposite to the Transportation Center entrance.)

Southbound (via Welsh St.)
- Right on Rt. 291
- Right on Edgemont St.
- Right on 4th St.
- Layover on 4th St. at Welsh St.

Northbound (via Welsh St.)
- Left on Welsh St. (from layover)
- Board passengers on Welsh St. opposite Transportation Center entrance
- Left on 7th St.
- Left on Avenue of the States then continuing on regular route

Temporary Stop Discontinuation | 16th & Walnut Sts.

Discontinued Until Monday, May 30, 2016

Due to construction, the Bus stop at 16th & Walnut Sts. is discontinued for Routes 9, 12, 21, and 42

Customers should use the next stop at 17th & Walnut Sts. for service

Please continue to check System Status for updates or additional information

Service Detours

Until Further Notice

Due to ramp construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Route 15 Detour Map | PDF

Service will operate around the construction with detours stops on Aramingo Ave. at York & Cumberland Sts.

Route 43 Bus To Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

Service going towards Parkside Loop will operate around the construction with detour stops on Huntingdon St. at Richmond, Edgemont, & Thompson Sts. and on Aramingo Ave. at Cumberland St., York St., & Delaware & Columbia Aves.

Service on Richmond St. between Cumberland & Beach Sts. and Beach St. to Delaware Ave. will be discontinued during this detour.

The construction is expected to last for approximately 2 years and Routes 15 and 43 service will be detoured during this time

Stop Temporarily Discontinued

Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the Bus Stop located on Market St. between 11th and 12th Sts. has been temporarily discontinued

As an alternate, customers should use the stop at 9th and Market Sts.

Customers may use the Trip Planner tool for alternate travel information

Stop Temporarily Discontinued

Until Further Notice

Due to area construction, the southbound stop at Roosevelt Blvd. and Holmes Ave. will be discontinued during the dates noted above

Customers can use Plan My Trip or Google Transit for alternate service information

Temporary Stop Discontinuation

Wednesday, April 16, 2014 Until Further Notice

Due to construction at 3rd & Market Streets, the 3rd & Chestnut Street stop has been discontinued until further notice

Customers should board the next stop at 3rd & Market Streets for service

Stop Temporarily Discontinued

Effective Wednesday, October 1, 2014 Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the Bus Stop located on Market St. between 11th and 12th Sts. has been temporarily discontinued

As an alternate, customers should use the stop at 9th and Market Sts.

Stop Discontinuation | 19th & Chestnut Sts. (1900 Block of Chestnut St.)

Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the Transit stop located at 19th & Chestnut Sts. will be temporarily discontinued

Customers should use Google transit for alternate stops and service information

Chestnut Bridge Weight Restrictions

Until Further Notice

Due to weight restrictions on the Chestnut Street Bridge, the SEPTA stops at 30th & Chestnut, Schuylkill Ave (29th St), and 24th Street on Chestnut Street are discontinued until further notice.

Southbound Route 9 buses will turn at 30th Street on to Market Street then 23rd Street before resuming their normal Chestnut Street routing.

SEPTA will continue to monitor all bus routes in this area and will make service and route adjustments as necessary.

Temporary Stop Discontinuation

Beginning Monday, March 30, 2015 - Until Further Notice

Due to area construction, the Eastbound Transit stop for Routes 92, 105, and 106 on Lancaster Ave. and Valley Rd. will be discontinued until further notice

Customers should use the next eastbound stop, located at Lancaster Ave. and Darby Rd.

Early Morning Weekend Shuttle Bus Substitution (Service towards Center City, Airport Terminals ONLY)

Saturday & Sunday, February 27-28, March 5-6, 12-13 & 19-20, 2016

Due to construction on the Jenkintown Substation, shuttle bus service will replace 3 early morning Airport Line trains at Glenside, Jenkintown-Wyncote, Elkins Park, and Melrose Park stations during the dates noted above.

Transfer from bus to train at Fern Rock Transportation Center

ALL trains will depart Fern Rock Transportation Center for service to Center City and Airport Terminals at the regularly scheduled time; however BUSES will depart Glenside, Jenkintown-Wyncote, Elkins Park, and Melrose Park stations 16 MINUTES EARLIER than regularly scheduled trains.

Schedule:

The schedule can be viewed below (click the image to enlarge) or downloaded as a PDF here

Printed schedules are also available at Center City stations

Additional Information:

All other Airport Line trains will operate as regularly scheduled. Please refer to the printed timetable with the December 13, 2015 effective date for complete service information

This project is part of the Rebuilding the System program

Shuttle bus boarding locations are noted in the timetable above. Please note, Jenkintown-Wyncote bus boarding located by gas station. Elkins Park, Melrose Park bus boarding located by Outbound parking lot.

Special Weekend Schedule

February & March, 2016

Due to construction at Secane Station, Saturday & Sunday trains will operate on a special schedule during the dates noted below. Customers should check the timetables below as some trains will operate at different times than regularly scheduled.

Media/Elwyn Line trains will also operate on a special Saturday & Sunday schedule during the dates noted above. Service information is available here

Special Schedule in Effect:

February: 13-14, 20-21, & 27-28
March: 19-20 & 26-27

During the Philadelphia Flower Show, ALL trains will operate as regularly scheduled. Please refer to the timetable with the December 2015 effective date

Schedule Information: Schedules can be viewed below or as a PDF by clicking here

(click on the images below to enlarge)

Changes to Inbound (towards Center City) Service:

MOST trains will depart 32 minutes LATER

Trains #703 & #705 (Sunday ONLY) will operate at the regularly scheduled time

Changes to Outbound (towards Chestnut Hill East) Service:

ALL trains will operate 2 minutes LATER

Additional Information:

Printed versions of the schedule are available at Center City stations

This station construction project is part of the Rebuilding the System Program

Temporary Sunday Boarding Location Change | Queen Lane - Highland Stations

Sunday, January 31 & February 7, 14, and 21, 2016

Due to track work, ALL trains will board from the following locations beginning at 6:00 a.m. and continuing until 6:00 p.m.:

Sunday, January 31:

ALL trains will board from the INBOUND (towards Center City) platforms at the stations listed below:

Sunday, February 7, 14, & 21:

ALL trains will board from the OUTBOUND (towards Chestnut Hill West) platform at the stations listed below:

Queen Lane Carpenter
Chelten Ave. Allen Lane
Tulpehocken St. Martins
Upsal Highland

Please continue to check System Status for any additional boarding information

WEEKDAY Schedule Change

Effective Monday, January 11, 2016

To address previous schedule errors and improve on-time performance and overall service reliability, ALL WEEKDAY Trains will operate on a new schedule beginning Monday, January 11th. Customers should refer to the timetables below for complete service information.

Service Information: Schedules can be viewed below or as a PDF by clicking here

(Click the images below to enlarge)

Changes to Inbound (towards Center City) Service:

Trains will depart between 2 and 6 minutes EARLIER

Outbound (towards Chestnut Hill West) Service:

Trains operating between Temple University and Chestnut Hill West will arrive LATER


Additional Information:

Printed schedules, effective Monday, January 11, 2016, are available at Center City stations. Please look for this schedule on posted signage at Chestnut Hill West stations

We know that customers rely on the information in the printed timetables and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and confusion these errors may have caused.

Lansdale Parking Garage Construction Project

Construction Update | Monday, November 23, 2015

Alternate Parking (Phase I)

Additional parking will be provided at the following SEPTA stations:

9th Street: 203 additional spaces (141 West 9th Street, Lansdale, PA 1944)

Pennbrook: 328 additional spaces available by September 21, 2015 (114 Church Rd., Lansdale, PA 19446)

North Wales: 74 additional spaces by September 21, 2015 (601 Beaver St., North Wales, PA 19454)

Learn more about this Rebuilding the System project here

Special Weekend Schedule & Opposite Side Boarding

February & March, 2016

Due to construction at Secane Station, Saturday & Sunday trains will operate on a special schedule during the dates noted below. Customers should check the timetables below as some trains will operate at different times than regularly scheduled.

Chestnut Hill East trains will also operate on a special Saturday & Sunday schedule during the dates noted above. Service information is available here

Special Schedule in Effect:

February: 13-14, 20-21, & 27-28
March: 19-20 & 26-27

During the Philadelphia Flower Show, ALL trains will operate as regularly scheduled. Please refer to the timetable with the December 2015 effective date

Schedule Information: The special weekend schedules can be viewed below or as a PDF by clicking here

(Click the images below to enlarge)

Changes to Inbound (towards Center City) Service:

Trains departing Elwyn, Media, Moylan-Rose Valley, Wallingford, Swarthmore, and Morton stations will depart at the regularly scheduled times

Some trains between Morton and Center City will operate between 1-2 minutes LATER

Changes to Outbound (towards Elwyn) Service:

ALL trains will depart Center City stations 32 minutes LATER

ALL trains will arrive at Elwyn Station 34 minutes LATER

Temporary Boarding Location Change:

Trains will board from the OUTBOUND (towards Elwyn) platform at Secane, Primos, Clifton-Aldan, Gladstone, Lansdowne, Fernwood-Yeadon, Angora, and 49th St. stations during the dates noted above. Please look for signage posted at stations for boarding information

Additional Information:

Printed schedules are available at Center City stations

The Secane Station construction project is part of the Rebuilding the System Program

Additional advisories for the Media/Elwyn Line are noted below

Secane Station Parking Notice

Effective Monday, January 11, 2016

Beginning Monday, January 11, 29 daily free parking spaces will be removed from this lot due to construction activities to improve Secane Station. Permit parking will not be impacted by this work.

Parking Options:

Clifton-Aldan Station: daily free spaces

Morton Station: AMVET Parking Lot (See Morton ticket agent for details and sales)

Questions?

Contact SEPTA Parking Operations at 215-580-3400

Visit the Rebuilding for the Future Program website for additional project information

Temporary Weekday Boarding Location Change

Beginning Monday, December 14, 2015 and Continuing Until Further Notice | 9:05 a.m. - 2:30 p.m.

Due to overhead wire work, all Trains will board from the Outbound (towards Elwyn) platform at the following stations:

Secane Lansdowne
Primos Fernwood
Clifton Angora
Gladstone 49th Street

Please check System Status regularly or listen for station announcements for any additional boarding information

Monday - Friday Boarding Location Change | Arrott Transportation Center and Church Station

Beginning Monday, February 22 and Continuing Through Friday, March 25, 2016 | 8:15 p.m. - End of Service

Due to Arrott Transportation Center construction, ALL weeknight trains will board from the EASTBOUND (towards Frankford Transportation Center) platform at the following stations:

Arrott Transportation Center

Church

Please listen for station announcements for any additional boarding information

current_message: All trains to board from the inbound platforms between Township Line Road and Wynnewood Road for the entire service day on Sunday, Feb. 21.
advisory_message:
Late Night Weekend Boarding Location Change | Between Township Line Rd. and Wynnewood Rd. Stations

Friday - Sunday, February 19-22 & 26-29, 2016 | 9:00 p.m. - End of Service

Due to track work, all trains will board from the Inbound (towards 69th St. Transportation Center) platform at the following stations:

Township Line Rd.

Penfield

Beechwood-Brookline

Wynnewood Rd.

Please check System Status for additional boarding information

Temporary Boarding Location Change | Township Line Rd. - Wynnewood Stations

Beginning Monday, January 4, 2016 and Continuing Through April 2016 | 9:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m.

Due to track work, all Trains will board from the Inbound (towards 69th St. Transportation Center) platform at the following stations beginning at 9:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.:

Township Line Rd.

Penfield

Beechwood-Brookline

Wynnewood Rd.

Please check System Status for updates or changes to this project

Radnor Station Improvement Project

Beginning November 2015 and Continuing Through Spring 2016

Beginning in November, Radnor Station will undergo renovations that include repairs to platforms and stairs, the installation of new guardrails and handrails, shelter improvements, updated lighting and signage, and new landscaping

During this project, customers should use the temporary stairs for access to/from station platforms

Alternate Customer Parking:

During construction, customers may choose to park at Villanova Station (Station Dr. & Lancaster Ave.).

Please continue to check System Status for updates on this project and additional service information

Temporary Weekend Boarding Location Change

Saturday, February 20 & Sunday, February 21, 2016 | Entire Service Day

Due to signal work, ALL trains will board from the following locations:

Saturday, February 20:

ALL trains will board from the Inbound (towards Center City) platform at the stations noted below

Sunday, February 21:

ALL trains will board from the Outbound (towards Norristown) platform at the stations noted below

Miquon

Spring Mill

Conshohocken

Please listen for station announcements or check System Status for any additional boarding information

SEPTA Norristown Parking Garage New Value Card System

Beginning Monday, January 18, 2016

SEPTA is modernizing the fare payment system at the Norristown Parking Garage and will be introducing a new, contactless chip Value Card to pay the $2.00 discounted daily parking fee beginning Monday, January 18th. Additional information is available here

Exton Station Improvement Project

Beginning Monday, October 19, 2015

In cooperation with Amtrak and the Pennsylvania Department of Transportation (PennDOT), SEPTA will begin Phase I of construction at Exton Station Monday, October 19, 2015. This phase is expected to last approximately 6 months

Impacts to Customer Parking:

While the work takes place, customer parking will be reduced by 12 spaces in the Outbound (toward Thorndale) lot. At the completion of Phase I, 67 additional spaces will become available for customer use. During construction, SEPTA has added 36 additional parking spaces at Whitford Station

View station renderings and learn more about this improvement project on the Rebuilding the System Program website

Levittown Station Improvement Project

Beginning Monday, November 2, 2015

In cooperation with Amtrak, SEPTA began Phase 1 of construction with the demolition of the former William Penn Bank building. Work will continue at the intersection of Fallsington Avenue and Route 13 in late October. Phase 1 is expected to extend into spring 2016.

Customer Impact

Beginning November 2, customer parking will be reduced in the inbound (towards Center City) lot. SEPTA has secured 80 parking spaces at St. Michael's Parrish (66 Levittown Parkway, Levittown, PA 19054) for use by SEPTA customers. Additional parking is available at Bristol Regional Rail Station (790 Washington St., Bristol, PA 19007).

Learn more about this project on the Rebuilding for the Future Program website

Temporary Sunday Boarding Location Change | Drexline - Huey Ave. Stations

Sunday, February 21, 2016 | 9:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m.

Due to Power Department work, all Trolleys will board from the Outbound (towards Media) platform at the following stations:

Drexeline

Drexelbrook

Anderson Ave.

Aronimink

School Lane

Huey Ave.

Please check System Status for any additional boarding information

advisory_message:
I-95 Reconstruction Program Service Detours

Until Further Notice

Due to ongoing construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Service will operate around the construction with detour stops on Aramingo Ave. at York & Cumberland Sts.

Richmond St. Closure

Effective Tuesday, February 4, 2014, Richmond St. is now closed due to construction. Shuttle buses will detour as follows:

Service towards Richmond & Westmoreland St.

From Aramingo Ave., shuttle buses will turn onto Thompson Street towards Allegheny Ave.

Service towards 63rd & Girard Ave.

From Allegheny Ave., shuttle buses will turn onto Belgrade St. towards Aramingo Ave.

Click here to view the detour map

Route 43 Bus to Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

Service going towards Parkside Loop will operate around the construction with detour stops on Huntingdon St. at Richmond, Edgemont, & Thompson Sts. and on Aramingo Ave. at Cumberland St., York St., & Delaware & Columbia Aves.

Service on Richmond St. between Cumberland & Beach Sts. and Beach St. to Delaware Ave. will be discontinued during this detour

The construction is expected to last for approximately two years. Routes 15 and 43 will be detoured during this time

Location: Southeast corner of 22nd St. and Spring Garden St.

Due to construction, the northbound stop at 22nd St. and Spring Garden will be discontinued during the dates noted above. Customers should board the Route 7 or 48 Bus at 22nd and Hamilton Sts.

Stop Temporarily Discontinued

Effective Wednesday, October 1, 2014 Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the Bus Stop located on Market St. between 11th and 12th Sts. has been temporarily discontinued

As an alternate, customers should use the stop at 9th and Market Sts.

Customers may use the Trip Planner tool for alternate travel information

advisory_message:
Detour & Boarding Location Change| Unstable Building

Until Further Notice

Due to an unstable building adjacent to the Chester Transportation Center entrance passengers will board on Welsh St. (opposite to the Transportation Center entrance.)

Detour (Eastbound and Westbound via Welsh St.)
- Left on 7th St.
- Left on Avenue of the States then continuing on regular route

Detour | I95 Bridge Weight Restriction

Until Further Notice

Due to a weight-restriction being imposed on the bridge over Interstate 95, Route 113 bus service will be detoured as follows:

The detour will be between MacDade Boulevard and Bullens Lane in Woodlyn (Ridley Township) and Morton and Melrose Avenues in Chester City and will impact service along Melrose Avenue, including Widener University

During the detour, Route 113 will operate via Bullens Lane, Chester Pike & Morton Avenue

For travel to Woodlyn Shopping Center, customers should use stops on Bullens Lane south of McDade

For travel to Widener University, customers should use stop on Morton Avenue at Melrose
